articles.title: Committees to remember Kim Il Sung formed
articles.content:
Committees to remember Kim Il Sung formed
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A Guyanese  committee for remembering H.E. the great leader Kim Il Sung was formed in Georgetown on June 4.   The reporter and speakers said at an inaugural meeting that the respected Kim Il Sung of  the Korean people was the most outstanding leader of the world, who devoted himself to the freedom and happiness of the people, the independent reunification of the country and the independence of oppressed people of the world.   
   The meeting set a retrospective period from June 4 to July 10 and decided to hold multifarious events.   A committee for remembering H.E. the great leader President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Madagascar on June 2.
   The inaugural meeting decided to hold a meeting, lecture,  film show, photo exhibition and other multifarious events for remembering the president, and to widely disseminate and follow his noble life devoted to the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Russian National Day observed
articles.content:
Russian National Day observed
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Russian ambassador to Korea Valery Denisov gave a party at the embassy on June 10 on the occasion of the National Day of Russia.
Invited to the party were Kang Jong Mo, Minister of Foreign Trade, Ri Song Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.
   Speeches were made at the party.

articles.content:
Release of cadres of general student councils
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of students of Hanyang University in Seoul held a demonstration  on June 7, demanding the release of 18 former and present cadres of the general student councils who were arrested on the charge of violating the "National Security Law," according to a report.
   The student demonstrators waged a stone-pelting battle with riot police.

S. Korean war hawks' provocative moves
articles.content:
S. Korean war hawks' provocative moves
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson today in a signed commentary flails the South Korean war hawks for illegally infiltrating their warships deep into the north side's territorial waters off the west coast in an unbroken chain.
   Their ceaseless military provocations clearly show how desperate the South Korean war hawks are becoming in their efforts to find an excuse for unleashing a new war at the beck and call of the U.S., the commentary observes.   
   It continues:   The South Korean war hawks are trying to find an excuse for northward invasion by fabricating a shocking "incident" in the region where the armed forces of the north and the south stand in acute confrontation.
   It is the mettle and spirit of the people and the People's Army of Korea to return fire for fire and mercilessly punish the provocateurs.
   The South Korean war hawks are well advised not to run amok, mindful that their provocation of a war just leads to self-destruction.

Greetings to Russian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Russian President
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to B.N. Yeltsin, President of the Russian Federation, on the occasion of the National Day of the country.   The message expressed the belief that the relations between the DPRK and the Russian Federation will develop on the principle of independence, equality and non-interference internal affairs and wished the Russian people success in their struggle for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il  received a gift from the China Journalist Association.The gift was handed to an official concerned by president Sun Yangren of the Farmers' Daily who is heading a delegation of the association on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam meets delegation of China Journalist Association
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam meets delegation of China Journalist Association
   Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Secretary Kim Ki Nam of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea  today met and conversed with a delegation of the China Journalist Association led by Sun Yangren, president of the Farmers' Daily, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
   Present there were Kim Sang Ho, vice-chairman of the c.c., the Korean Journalists Union, and Li Bin, Chinese charge d'affaires ad interim  to Korea.
